dialogues.DOUG:
[1]What "stuff"? This party isn't going to be fancy, is it? Just some friends and a wing platter from Costco?

[3]I went to medical school. You think I don't know how carbs work?

[5]Yes, I have emergencies. That's what my pager is for. one beep from that thing, and bam. I'm off. Like a cheetah. Billy, now pouring lucky charms into a bowl, looks up. 
[6]I did do that. I forgot about that. I need to get some batteries in there. Because dentists do have emergencies. We are doctors, you know? We take the same oath. The oath of saving lives. Doug goes to take some of Billy's discarded Lucky Charms. Billy swats his hand away. 
[7]You know, I use to race a car like this. Put a hemi under the hood... Nobody saw me coming. 
[8]Yup. It could really... smoke some ass. Billy raises his eyebrows, impressed. Doug smiles. This was a good time to break the "no saying ass" rule. 
[9]Yes, sir. They called it the dragon wagon. You're lucky to be in here without a helmet, pal. We both are. Doug downshifts a gear, and the tame engine roars artificially. Billy is impressed. 
[10]Heck yeah, you can jam the radio. Doug tussles Billy's hair and smiles. 
[11]Hey, honey. INTERCUT WITH KELLY: On the phone at home. 
[12]Me? Oh, yeah. I've got a mouth right here in front of me. Doug takes a dental tool and hammers on the plastic mouth. 
[13]Well, it's not attached to a head, really. More research. Doug hits the mouth too hard and all the teeth fall out. He fumbles to stop them from scattering everywhere. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 11. 
[14]I don't know. Do you think we really need to stay at a hotel? I mean, Billy has his own room. Why don't we just buy new sheets? Like, hotel-colored ones. It'll be like the Ritz, but we won't have to pay to make phone calls! 
[15]What? I'm just saying-- Suddenly, the speaker comes on overhead. 
[16]Emergency? I've got to go! Emergency! Doug jumps out of his seat and scrambles over his desk and out the door. 
[17]Acute molar abscess. That's going to need emergency surgery. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 12. 
[18]Yeah. Well, let's send him over to an Orthopedic surgeon.

[21]Well, that's not really my shot. I usually hit from downtown, you know? Doug grabs the ball out of the bushes and dribbles back to the three point line. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 13.

[23]That was a pass, dudes! It wasn't. Doug nods with false confidence to the kids, stands there awkwardly for a moment, then quietly heads inside.

I'm like a lion that used to be wild, but now I'm in some Disney park where tourists come by and take pictures of me like I'm a lion, but after they leave, I go into my kennel and eat antelope nuggets or something. [74]I thought it was. But now, I realize that ipod was just a well-designed whore. The guys smile. It's been a good night for all of them. 
[75]It's that blue port-o-potty juice. It's coming out of the can. 
[76]Oh, man. I thought it was going to happen slowly. I thought I had time! Dudley sits on the fountain edge and starts to tear up. 
[77]Crap. I was thinking of that for us. 
[78]You do? Doug shrugs weakly. 
[79]No, no. I mean, I thought about going to see Maggie while those guys are asleep, but you need me right now. 
[80]You're always asking me if I'm okay! Dudley quickly storms out of the police station. Doug nods to himself and slumps down on an office chair. 
[81]Sorry those jerks are in your diner. 
[82]It makes me sick. Thinking they're too good for pancakes. 
[83]This has been the best vacation of my life. I met you. Maggie blushes. 
[84]Maggie, I have to tell you something. I'm not really a cool biker or a cool... anything. I'm a computer programmer. A nerd. My cat doesn't even like me. She watches me sleep and I don't know why. I think she's waiting for me to stop breathing. I'm just a... Geek. I'm sorry if you thought I was somebody I'm not. Maggie takes this in. After a moment, she smiles and kisses Dudley. 
[85]Oh, people will eat. Don't you worry, Maggie. People will eat. 
[86]Alright, let's end this! The Hells Angels don't even notice him. Dudley bites his lip in frustration. 
[87]Hey! ! Dudley takes a table full of empty beer glasses and flips it over. Everyone in the diner goes silent and looks at him. Jack stands up and smiles. 
[88]I'm not here to face any music. I'm here to make you a deal. A deal I think you'd be smart to take. 
[89]You leave the town of Lucas, and my friends alone, and I do something for you. Something you can't live without. Jack looks interested. Dudley confidently sets a laptop on the counter, and punches a few keys. He swivels it around to show the gang. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 97. 
[90]See where that says "Domain for sale?" Guess what that means. Your gang doesn't have a website! Nothing! No way to tell people about your history, post photos, sell shirts... You guys are living in the complete dark ages!  So they way I see it: I need a favor from you and you need a favor from me. Jack walks over to the computer and looks at Dudley for a moment. He then picks the computer up and smashes it down on the ground. It breaks into a hundred pieces. Jack smiles at Dudley and puts his foot through what's left of it. The Hells Angels stifle laughter. Dudley is starting to look a little nervous. 
[91]Okay, then. Thanks for hearing me out. Dudley starts for the door, but several Hells Angels move over and block his path. Dudley stops and collects himself for a moment - then breaks into a panicked sprint for the other exit. The Hells Angels quickly spring into action and tackle him to the ground. 
[92]Sanctuary! Sanctuary!! The Hells Angels pull off him, confused. 
[93]Sanctuary. You have to take me to a church and leave me alone. The Hells Angels look at each other and shrug. 
[94]I know. The Hells Angels move back in on him. Dudley closes his eyes and rolls into a ball. 
[95]No, I actually feel pretty-- Jack kicks Dudley's chair with his foot. It tips over and lands on it's side - with Dudley in it. Dudley looks out at the floor, helpless. 
[96]Ow! Hey, a peanut. Dudley tries to stick his tongue out to get the peanut. Jack notices and kicks it away. 
[97]Crap. 
[98]Don't bring the money, guys! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 102. 
[99]I'm a computer programmer! I don't need my legs! Jack considers this and turns back to the phone. 
[100]Dammit.  Bring the money! 
[101]Hey can we call my cat, now? She needs to hear my voice. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 103. Jack looks down at Dudley, then to the other bikers. 
[102]Crap. 
[103]Hey, guyth. Doug shakes his head. 
[104]Ahhhhhhhhhhh! Dudley charges Jack, but his limited mobility results not in a tackle, but in him leaning on Jack. After a moment, Jack takes a step back and Dudley falls to the ground. 
[105]Ow. Jack cracks his knuckles and looks to OILCAN. 
[106]Ow. Ow! Ow, ow. Ow. Ow!... After a painful minute, Dudley is untaped. Charley looks at Jack's jacket. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 115. 
[107]Yeah, I'll take the Sportster back, I guess. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 116. Jack just stares at the trashed motorcycle, mortified. 
[108]Let's ride. They start their motorcycles. The engines roar to life.
dialogues.BOB:
[1]Hey, honey. 
[2]Well, I'm technically at the office right now, so... The door behind him flings open, and KAREN LEVENSTEIN, attractive and harsh-looking, steps in holding a phone. 
[3]I know, I was just trying to make this 
[4]Actually, I need to talk to you-- 
[5]If that's about the party, you-- 
[6]Well, I really have to finish my-- 
[7]You bought this shirt for me. I was fine with my t-shirts-- 
[8]What? 
[9]Well, I have to get another-- 
[10]You going to wear that? 
[11]You're cool with the carbs? Doug pauses, without turning around. 
[12]What are you talking about? This place is cool. We're with other bikers. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 17. Suddenly, a large, bald biker comes up and slams a beer down on their table. 
[13]Hard. 
[14]Sorry. I didn't... Don't tell her. 
[15]Well, Kelly must still think you're hot. Ten years, man. How's that feel? 
[16]I don't know, man. 
[17]No... 
[18]Doug! Are you okay? 
[19]Oh, man. Thank god. 
[20]Oh, she's waiting in the parking-- SFX: A loud honk from the parking lot. 
[21]That's her. Bob looks out the window nervously. Kelly looks at Doug. 
[22]Yeah? Are you sure? I mean, We'll be leaving behind everything we're used to. SFX: The horn honks again from outside. 
[23]A tattoo? You got a tattoo? 
[24]Yeah, the way I mapped it out - we should be a hundred miles past St. Louis by sundown. 
[25]He's right, Doug. Wild Hogs! Bob takes his cellphone and throws it in the storm drain. 
[26]Yup. Bob starts his bike. 
[27]This is more comfortable.  I wish Karen would have let me buy the foot pump, though. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 33. Bob continues to inflate the mattress, as Dudley approaches with a knotted plastic grocery bag. 
[28]It's been awhile. You're not as obnoxious as you used to be. You used to eat a lot more buffalo wings, too. 
[29]I know what you're talking about. I lost old Bob, too. I think my wife and daughters killed him. I'm surrounded by women every minute of my life. And it's made me, you know... 
[30]What? No. I was going to say miserable. You think I'm a wimp? 
[31]You know, it's not always so bad. Like, when Karen sleeps, she still crawls over and pushes up against me. Just snuggles right up like she needs me. I like that. I like that a lot.  Then the sun comes up and turns her into a raging she-demon. 
[32]Hey, Dudley. You've got us, buddy. And you're going to get a woman, too. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 36 
[33]I told you we were going to hit some strip clubs when we get back. 
[34]Dudley-- Please. I'm trying to help you here. 
[35]Please! Strippers are nice to me! 
[36]Thanks, man. I'm just... trying to be a good friend. 
[37]I think I'm half way there. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 37. 
[38]Thanks for waiting for me, jerks. The guys look up to see that Bob is naked. He smiles and cannonballs into the water. 
[39]Whhheew: Yeah! That's c-c-cold: He sees DOUG, WOODY and DUDLEY are just staring at him. 
[40]What? 
[41]We're swimming. You guys kept on your skivies? 
[42]I don't know. We took showers and stuff together in college. I thought this was kind of... you know, the same. 
[43]You think? They're gone, now. 
[44]Dammit! Leg's asleep. The guys go to help Bob up, as Dudley gets off his bike and falls to the ground. 
[45]Oh, man. Check it out. A 1951 Panhead. You know how rare this thing is? The guys all crowd around the bike. 
[46]Hells Angels, huh? You guys are legends. I'm surprised we've never seen you in Daytona. The bikers kind of chuckle to themselves. The leader of the gang, JACK, steps forward. He's in his late 40's - and looks like he could break you into bite size pieces. 
[47]What? Are you nuts? 
[48]Seriously? 
[49]Yeah, I actually agree with you on this one. Let's not call wives. 
[50]Hey! Let's stop for breakfast, I'm starving. 
[51]I just said I was-- 
[52]That's how these little towns are. It's unspoiled America. 
[53]Wow. Everyone is so nice, here. The guys sit in one of the booths. Dudley hangs back, and struggles to talk to Maggie. 
[54]Yeah, just don't let it happen again! Bob hammers his fist on the table and laughs at his joke, but Maggie starts to cry. The guys suddenly look confused as she runs to the kitchen in tears. Bob looks back to the guys. 
[55]Wow. That wasn't funny. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 59. 
[56]What schedule? You said we're taking this trip to live. Let's stick around and live a little. Have some small town fun! Woody goes to protest again, but Dudley stands up. 
[57]I'm not a wimp, pal'. I'm a man! You got that? Huh? You got that!! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 61. The guys look at Bob, wide-eyed. woody looks worried. 
[58]No, you know what? This guy needs a talking to just like his friends did, Woody. 
[59]Let me do this, Woody! You stood up to them last time, and I just sat there like I always do... Well, not this time!  Listen, you piece of shit. You think you can just walk around and bully perfectly nice people? You think that's how it works? Well, guess what? This is the real world. With real laws and real consequences. You hear me!? Bob swats Murdock's beer out of his hand. It spills all over him. Murdock is too filled with rage to speak. 
[60]Now get out of here! And if that gang of inbred assholes needs things explained to them again, tell 'em the Wild Hogs will be right here in Lucas tonight. Woody puts his face into his hands. 
[61]Now get. Murdock just stares daggers at him. 
[62]Get! Bob kicks the stool out from under Murdock. He almost falls, but catches himself on a stool. He glares at the guys, but he's outnumbered. He grits his teeth and storms out the door. Woody winces to himself as he watches Murdock go. This isn't good. After a moment, BUD comes running out from behind the bar. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 62. 
[63]Hey-- we should probably share the credit. I mean, I just basically kicked that guy's ass. Man! You know how good that felt!? Yeah! Bob punches a handicapped parking sign, which rattles against its post, then falls to the ground. Bob immediately looks regretful. 
[64]Should I fix it? Oh, man. I should. I'm sorry... I didn't mean to-- 
[65]You ride this? 
[66]Yeah. They think we're bad asses. 
[67]It's true. He was unclogging his bathtub drain and the cat thought it was a ball of yarn. Doug and Woody wince. ANGLE ON: DUDLEY, at the beer tent. He gets in line, and realizes he's behind MAGGIE. She smiles at him. 
[68]That's a lot of carbs. Doug stops, mid-bite, and puts the bread down. 
[69]Well... Still a nice town. 
[70]Yeah. This is good for him. 
[71]Hey! Leave him alone! You want some of this!? Come get this! Bob sprints out into the field. The bull snorts and starts towards him. The Bull closes on Bob quick, but at the last moment Bob dives of the way. The bull goes flying past him. 
[72]Hah! Missed me, you fat bastard! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 77. Doug and Woody look impressed as Bob helps them hurry towards the fence. Charley and Buck hold a gate open for them as the Bull makes a turn and lines the group up, but they've already made it to the gate. They go through and Charley shuts it behind them. They lean back on the fence, trying to gather their bearings, except Bob - who is thrilled. 
[73]Did you see me? I dodged him! I dodged that stupid cow! How cool am-- Suddenly, the Bull charges into the fence, which Bob's butt is sticking through. Bob goes flying and lands face down in the dirt. He scrambles back up, furious. 
[74]You son of a bitch! You want to keep it going!? You want to take cheap shots!? Come on! Bob tries to climb back into the pasture, but the guys restrain him. 
[75]Give me your gun! Give me the gun! He deserves it! I'll kill you! Doug and Woody hold on to Bob until he calms down. Doug and Woody start to laugh. Bob cools off for another moment, then starts laughing as well. 
[76]I'm going to go back there with a rifle tomorrow and shoot one of his legs off. Then we'll see who's tough. 
[77]Because I want to kick him in the face. Doug and Woody laugh again. Bob just steams. They spot DUDLEY, and head over to him. 
[78]Wild Hogs ride! The guys continue with enthusiastic cheers as we hear the off-screen rumble of engines. Doug looks down the street and sees: THE HELLS ANGELS. All forty of them are riding into town - and the guys will be in their view any second. Woody is frozen with fear. 
[79]You son of a bitch! Bob lunges at Woody, but the sudden shifting of weight is too much for the port-o-potty... 
[80]What is that? 
[81]It got in my hair! Gross! The guys desperately try to rinse off the juice - then, drenched from head to toe, turn their glare to Woody. 
[82]You did! You're a stinking liar! 
[83]Well, I talked to Karen. She going to fly out here, rent a mini-van, and pick us up. We'll just ship the bikes back later. 
[84]So what? They can call the National guard or something. 
[85]Well, Karen is really insistent she come drive us back. 
[86]I can't do that. 
[87]Oh, sorry I'm not brave like you, Doug! The guy who gets injections in his scalp so he won't go bald! Bob storms out the back door of the police station. Dudley looks to Doug, curiously. 
[88]Hey, guys. 
[89]Are we all good? 
[90]Shit. Hold on. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 94. Bob grabs another paddle and throws it. This time it lands even shorter. Bob looks around for another paddle. 
[91]Yeah. 
[92]You guys'll drift in. 
[93]Where are Buck and Earl? 
[94]That's it. He's never had a girlfriend so he's probably getting carried away. He once drank eighteen Mocha Latte's because the Starbucks clerk was smiling at him. 
[95]No way. They said no law. We can't risk them doing anything to Dudley. 
[96]I'm going to call Karen and have the cash wired out of our savings. 
[97]Let's go slap the bull. Doug smiles and taps fists with Bob and Woody. 
[98]Yeah, Doug! 
[99]Alright, Mother f-- Bob suddenly trips on the lead pipe and hits the ground. Doug shakes his head. 
[100]I'm in, too! Let's ride to San-- Suddenly, a mini-van pulls up. KAREN and KELLY hop out. 
[101]Um... Actually, we just decided we were going to keep pressing West for a few-- 
[102]--Karen! Karen stops talking, shocked by Bob raising his voice. 
[103]Listen to me. This is My vacation and if I want to ride on with my friends, well that's what I'm going to do! And if you have a problem with that, well... Tough shit! There's a moment of silence as Karen absorbs this. The guys all look at Bob proudly. After a few seconds, Karen's face softens. 
[104]I will. And... I love you. Bob smiles at her and gets on his bike. ANGLE ON: DOUG and KELLY. Kelly looks at Doug.
dialogues.JACK:
[1]Yeah, how do we keep missing that? The bikers all laugh. Doug and the guys join in, though they don't quite get what's so funny. 
[2]So you re "Wild Hogs," huh? That's your gang? 
[3]So it's like a little hobby for you guys? How sweet. Doug smiles, but is now sensing the hostility. He looks back for the exit. 
[4]Wow. That's great. Can I try that on? 
[5]Well, if you like my '51, we should trade... "brother." 
[6]A Sportster!? That's what I grew up on. I've been wanting another Sportster. It's a deal! 
[7]Come on, Dud. Let's go see how you look on it. Jack smiles and leads Dudley outside. Doug, Bob and Woody share an uncertain look. 
[8]Oh, no, no. That's Oilcan's ride. My 
[9]Yup. Your piece of junk. Woody, Doug and Bob look at each other. This isn't good. Doug tries to laugh it off. 
[10]Oh, it's no joke. You want to know the joke? Suburban assholes that buy leather outfits and think they're bikers. And it's a joke I'm damn sick of. So I'm keeping your friend's bike, I'm keeping this jacket, and you guys are going to turn the hell around and go back to wherever you came from, because the next hundred miles of this highway belongs to the Hells Angels. The color drains from the Wild Hog's faces. 
[11]Like a "Go home or we're going to split your skulls open" thing. Bob makes an audible whimper. Doug elbows him, and tries to look brave. 
[12]You're right. We're going to have to work something out. 
[13]Saddle up, boys. Somebody doesn't listen. The guys nod and head outside. Oilcan pulls the dart out of his shoulder, and stops by Jack on the way out. 
[14]What the f--  You've gotta be kidding me. Suddenly, the cigarette falls out of Jacks mouth, and onto the ground. A puddle of gas from the sliced line catches on fire. 
[15]shit. The flames quickly follow the line of leaked gas like a fuse, back towards the bar. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 52. Almost as quickly as the bikers can turn to look, the flame has reached the parking area and ignited all the puddles of gas. They all watch in horror as the fire ravenously engulfs the old wooden porch of the bar, then the roof ... 
[16]Forget it. Those guys are long gone. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 53. 
[17]They're not stupid enough to stop until they're five hundred miles from here. 
[18]Those assholes think they can cross the Hells Angels? Do you know how bad they've made us all look!? The gang nods. They all look pissed. 
[19]Those guys have some balls. Balls I will put in my mouth and chew on!! The gang looks at Jack with a slight smile. OILCAN chuckles. 
[20]No! I'm not-- I'm going to put my foot up their asses! Both feet! Hell, I'm going to stick anything I can in their asses, and I'm going to enlov it. The guys start laughing again. Jack boils red. 
[21]Shut up!! I didn't mean-- Just get on your damn bikes! We're riding to Lucas! The guys start towards their bikes. Oilcan sidles up next to Jack. 
[22]I did that in my mind, first. Jack smiles calmly and walks off. 
[23]Good evening, Lucas. Now, as hurt as I am that you're having a party and didn't invite us... We're only here for one reason. The "Wild Hogs." Where the hell are they!? 
[24]Come on, now. You shouldn't be protecting them. These "Wild Hogs," not only passed us when we specifically told them not to, they drained out all our gas and burned down our bar. Like the little cowards they are. Now where are they!!? "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 81. 
[25]Now, that's a port-o-potty that ain't worth shit. The Hell's Angels all laugh and turn back to the diner. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 82. 
[26]All right, then. Nobody wants to tell me where they are? Fine. Maybe this'll jar your memory. Jack takes a garbage can and tosses it into the diner window. The crowd gasps, as the Hells Angels laugh. CHARLEY steps out of the crowd. 
[27]Good.  Saddle up, boys. The guys get on their bikes. 
[28]And if they ain't there. We'll be back reeeal soon. Because I don't let any man get away from me. The gang snickers. Jack realizes; 
[29]Shut the hell up! I didn't-- You know what I meant! Jack starts his bike and roars out of the town. The others follow him, gunning their bikes and leaving skid marks and smoke in their trail. A kid yells at the Hells Angels as they ride out of sight. 
[30]Alright, Wild Hogs. We know you're in town somewhere, 'cause you haven't checked out of the hotel. We're a little smarter than you thought, huh? 
[31]So we're going to wait right here 'till you show up. Weeks, if we have to. Hell, we might just make ourselves the "Lucas Angels." That has a nice ring to it, doesn't it? "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 86. Jack laughs. 
[32]Well, well. One of you came to face the music, huh? That's brave. And stupid. The Hells Angels laugh. Dudley takes a deep breath and walks up to Jack. 
[33]Yeah? What deal? 
[34]No deal. Dudley nods. 
[35]Try again, asshole. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 101. 
[36]Damn right, the Hells Angels. Your friend paid us a little visit. And now he's hurting reeeeal bad. 
[37]So here's what we're going to do, now. You guys are going to pay us a visit. And you're going to bring a "disobedience fee," of ten thousand dollars. Cash. And don't even think about calling any cops. Just you guys and ten grand. And if you don't show up in an hour - Well then, We'll just take the fine out of your friend's legs... Which we're going to break with a tire iron. 
[38]His hands! We'll break his hands! 
[39]Oh, I won't touch him if you bring that money. But if you don't, I'll be touching him all night long. And I'll be enjoying it. The other bikers suddenly stifle laughter. 
[40]What!? There was nothing wrong with that one! That was tough! Those guys are afraid of me, now. They know how much I want 'em! The gang laughs again. 
[41]Shut up!! The gang stops laughing, off Jack's warning glare. Dudley looks up from the floor. 
[42]Get me more duct tape? A biker nods and grabs another role of duct tape. He heads over to Dudley. 
[43]Well, well. The "Wild Hogs." I'm glad to see you're finally showing us a little respect. 
[44]Sure. Where's the cash? Doug looks to Bob and Woody. They nod encouragingly. Doug gathers his courage and turns back to Jack. 
[45]Excuse me? 
[46]What did you just call me? 
[47]You know what? I was just going to pulverize your friend, here. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 107. 
[48]But now I'm pissed off. You're all going to get hurt. Hells Angels style. Guys! The Hells Angles nod and pick up various weapons: Crowbars, tire irons, bats... They start moving towards Doug, Woody and Bob. Bob looks to Doug. 
[49]Hear that, guys!? He called you all fat! 
[50]Me against you? 
[51]All right. Let's party, tough guy. 
[52]Time for your beating, yuppie! 7/06/05 109. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 
[53]Don't get tired yet. The hurt is just beginning. Doug tries to stand back up, but it's getting harder. He slyly grabs a handful of sand as he starts to stand. 
[54]Man, this isn't even a workout. Jack laughs and puts his aviator sunglasses back on, as Doug quickly stands up and whips around at him. 
[55]This one's gonna break bone. 
[56]What? 
[57]You're a dentist? "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 111. 
[58]All right. Now you're going to die. Jack approaches Doug, who closes his eyes and waits for the end. 
[59]Anybody else the leader of this gang? Bob takes a deep breath, and bends down an grabs a long lead pipe. He starts towards Jack. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 112. 
[60]Well, I guess that's all of you-- DUDLEY, still covered in tape, comes running into the circle from the other side. 
[61]Give me the crowbar. Oilcan nods and hands it to Jack. Jack smiles at the four fallen Wild Hogs. 
[62]Guess you guys are wishing you'd listened, now, huh? Jack smiles as we hear: 
[63]Are you kidding? And what makes you think you can ride a motorcycle without our permission? 
[64]What? You're going to shoot us? 
[65]No way. He can have his Sportster back. 
[66]Hope you're happy. You suburban posers are a disease. You need to learn some damn respect for real bikers. Doug smiles. 
[67]Get what?
dialogues.CHARLEY:
[1]I'll move it! Hold on, I'll move it! Charley jumps into the car and backs it out of its spot. The guys look at each other, surprised. 
[2]You guys aren't Hells Angels? 
[3]Well, sweet Mary Joseph... Welcome to Lucas! I'm the sheriff, Charley Baskins. I keep the peace here. 
[4]Well... A non-confrontation approach sometimes is the best method to keep aggression... Yeah, I was hiding in the kitchen. Charley looks at them for a moment, then starts to tear up. 
[5]I'm an embarrassment. Charley hurries off to the bathroom. The guys look at each other. 
[6]Sorry about all the confusion when you arrived. Those guys are pretty rough. You're the first people to ever stand up to them. 
[7]Forget about it. We only have one cripple and he gets pulled around in a wagon. Come on, I want to show you guys something. Charley leads the guys off. 
[8]Oh, no. The Hells Angels would take it to pieces if they ever saw me on it. I just keep it in here. Polish it and so forth. But I'd never let them see it. 
[9]Yeah. They ride into town a few times a month and get drunk, damage property... Basically turn the place upside down. 
[10]Well, It's a small town - and me and the Dooble brothers are the only law. And they're still pretty green. 
[11]Yeah, I've done that a few times. But the gang is always gone by the time they get here. We've also tried wearing riot gear, which does protect you from being hit, but not from being dragged. Also, one of the Dooble brothers tried to throw tear gas, but the bottle exploded and blew off his ear. 
[12]Yeah, he's hard to look at. Anyway, we want you guys to stay at our hotel tonight on us... Seeing as you're the new town heroes and all. "wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 65. The guys look flattered. Except Woody. 
[13]And if you're not in a rush to leave in the morning-- We've got a great trout stream you might want to check out. 
[14]Howdy, guys! Welcome to the block party! These are my deputies: Earl and Buck Dooble. Earl shakes the guys hands. 
[15]Yeah, we got everything here. Good people, good fishing... 
[16]Not if they don't have kids, Earl. 
[17]Looks like your friend and Maggie are hitting it off. 
[18]Well, Maggie's a great woman. 
[19]So, why are you guys taking this road trip, anyway? 
[20]I know what you mean. Sometimes things in life can bother you, and sometimes nothing in life can bother you. Either way, you've got take a break from it. Happiness is somewhere between boredom and stress. Doug is surprised at Charley's insight. So is Woody. 
[21]Old Doug? 
[22]Woody's got a point, there. Comfortable can be a bad thing. You have to wake up and slap the bull once in a while. 
[23]Slapping the bull is kind of the local test of manhood. It's a way to prove you aren't controlled by fear. We've all done it. 
[24]Here we are. The Lucas test of manhood. Slap the bull. Charley gestures to a lone bull grazing in the pasture. He's a frighteningly large bull with enormous horns. 
[25]Sure. Glad we could help. 
[26]I think they're out at Mckinley's pasture. Something about slapping a bull. It's up past the lake a ways. Jack smiles. 
[27]Looks like they're winding down some. 
[28]You guys just stay in the station tonight. No one needs to go out there and be a hero and end up getting hurt. 
[29]Wow. So... You're not going out there? Doug sighs in irritation. 
[30]That's not cool, man. Charley runs out the back door of the station. EARL shakes his head and looks at Doug. 
[31]Hey, guys. Having your final meal? Charley laughs. Doug, Bob and Woody don't. 
[32]Sorry. 
[33]They're coming. Buck's ear is giving him some equilibrium problems. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 99. EARL ENTERS, holding the door open for BUCK, who walks through slowly. 
[34]That's out of line, guys. 
[35]We sure are. I'm going to call the Highway Patrol. They'll be there in-- 
[36]I don't think that's the safest plan. 
[37]All right, Jack. That'll be enough of that. 
[38]I'll ride whatever I want from now on. I'm the sheriff of Lucas, and I'm not tolerating any more lawlessness. BOB helps DOUG, WOODY, and DUDLEY to their feet, as Jack takes a step towards Charley. 
[39]I'd stop right there, Jack. Earl and Buck get out of the cruiser with two shotguns. They cock the guns and walk to Charley's side. Jack looks concerned. 
[40]No. Not unless you want to do something stupid like ignoring-- Buck grabs his missing ear as he starts to loose his balance. He tips over and falls. As he hits the ground, the shotgun fires and hits OILCAN in the leg. Oilcan falls to the ground. 
[41]Um... Yeah, I guess we're going to shoot you. The Hells Angels suddenly look nervous, and back up a few steps. Charley steps towards Jack. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 114. 
[42]We're not going to live in fear of your gang anymore, Jack. If the Wild Hogs can stand up to you - so can everyone of us. The crowd of townspeople gathers behind Charley and nods. 
[43]The point is, from now on you need to treat Lucas with kindness and respect. And when you do, you'll be treated the same. And if you don't... Charley looks over at OILCAN, who's tending to the bullet wound in his thigh. 
[44]Then I guess we'll keep... shooting you. Got it? Jack looks at all the townspeople. He knows he's beaten. He nods bitterly. 
[45]Good. Now I'd like you to untape our friend Dudley. Jack signals to one of the Hells Angels. He grabs Dudley's tape and spins him around to untape him. 
[46]And I believe that's his jacket. Jack begrudgingly takes off Dudley's "Wild Hogs" jacket and tosses it to him. Dudley proudly puts it on. 
[47]And as I recall, that '51 Panhead was traded to Dudley. Jack looks over at the mint condition motorcycle and shakes his head. 
[48]Uh uh. A deal's a deal, Jack. Jack grits his teeth and throws a set of keys at Dudley. The crowd chatters in approval as Dudley gets on the '51 Panhead and starts the engine. He revs it a few times and Jack shoots Doug an infuriated glare. 
[49]Well, I wish you guys would stay longer.
dialogues.KELLY:
[1]I've got some stuff to do for the party tomorrow. Can you take Billy to school? 
[2]It's a our 10th anniversary, Doug. Its going to be a nice party with nice food and nice music. And wings have carbs, so you can't eat them anyway. 
[3]Doug, can you take Billy or not? 
[4]You have emergencies? 
[5]You busy? 
[6]Don't they mind you being on the phone? 
[7]Oh. Well, I just wanted to tell you I found a great rate for the Ritz-Carlton tomorrow night. I Thought it might be romantic. Mom can stay here with Billy. 
[8]
[9]Hey, honey. Snack? Kelly hands Doug a sandwich bag of celery. He looks over to the table, where Kelly has laid out Ritz crackers covered in cheez whiz, for the kids. Doug puts the bag of celery down. 
[10]Okay. Lite beer, if you want to stick to that diet. 
[11]Hey, sweetie. Having fun? 
[12]It's eight O'Clock. It started at seven. 
[13]People are having fun. Look at the Miltons. ANGLE ON: THE LIVING ROOM. A happy-looking couple, THE MILTONS, are dancing around to Prince's "1999." Doug laughs. 
[14]No, Fred's having a good time. With his wife. Remember what that was like? 
[15]I don't care. Why do you? Doug searches for a response, as ROGER, 70, Kelly's Dad, clinks his wine glass at the front of the room. 
[16]Doug, stop it. You're being rude. 
[17]You're not the same, Doug. The old Doug wouldn't have made fun of Fred Milton for dancing, because he would have been out there dancing himself. With me. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 24. 
[18]I'm saying you have changed. And frankly, i don't like it. I like you the way you were. I liked it when you weren't afraid of looking stupid. I liked it when we laughed. I liked it when we danced. 
[19]Honey, stop it. You're being an ass. 
[20]Doug? What's wrong? Are you okay? 
[21]Doug!? 
[22]Only mathematically. Doug takes this in. 
[23]Doug, Let me ask you a question. When was the last time you sang a Bon Jovi song? 
[24]You used to sing Bon Jovi songs at the top of your lungs. Like you didn't care who heard you, or how dopey it sounded. Then one day, you just stopped. That's how it's been with everything. Romance, sense of humor, the way you used to give me that cocky little wink when you took off your shirt... It's all faded away, leaving just a shell of what you used to be. Why? Why no more Bon Jovi songs? 
[25]Like what? You have a great career, a perfect family. Money is fine. The only thing that could be weighing you down is me. Is it me? Are you tired of me? 
[26]Then eat them. I'd rather have you sing than have a thirty-four waist. 
[27]No, you don't, Doug. I buy your pants. Look. We've been married ten years. And personally, I'd like to be married fifty more, but if you stay like this... Then... I don't know... 
[28]I took it away from him at the party. He wouldn't stop waving it at Bob and Dudley. 
[29]It might be. But I'm desperate, Doug. I want us to be happy again. So go on it. It's my anniversary present to you. 
[30]All I want is old Doug back. Please. This marriage can't survive without him. Doug takes this in, and smiles at her. She's a good wife, and he knows it. Suddenly, BOB enters the room. 
[31]Where's Karen? 
[32]You all need this trip. Doug gives her a knowing nod, then turns to Bob. 
[33]Hey, honey. Kelly kisses Doug. He smiles, glad to see her. 
[34]Karen said you guys were in trouble. I kept calling your cell, but somebody programmed it to not receive calls from our house. Doug shoots Woody a look. 
[35]So are you going, too? 
[36]There he is! I saw old Doug! Doug blushes. 
[37]What about work? And Billy's school? Doug shrugs like he hasn't a care in the world.
dialogues.MAGGIE:
[1]Just stay calm, Dad. At least it's not all of them, this time. 
[2]I'll take care of them, Daddy.  Good morning. Maggie smiles. She has a radiant sweetness, even though she's scared to death. DUDLEY stares at her, captivated. He's in love. 
[3]where would you gentleman like to sit? 
[4]And what would you gentleman like today? Doug looks to the next table, where a man is enjoying french toast. 
[5]Of course. I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. Maggie quickly puts it back on the man's table. 
[6]Hi. Dudley is wide-eyed. 
[7]Excuse me? 
[8]Wow. You like macs too, huh? I've got a vintage Apple 2e. Restored it from scratch. Dudley's jaw drops. 
[9]Wow. I like fig newtons. Dudley collects himself and tries to speak. 
[10]You want to dance? Dudley goes to respond, then decides to just give an emphatic nod. Maggie smiles. 
[11]Well, we can't seat many people in there, but at least we're back in business. 
[12]Ah, we're used to them costing us money. Last year we spent more on window glass than pancake batter. All because of them. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 95. 
[13]No, I meant... They damage the diner a lot. They damage the whole town. I'm just sorry you guys got dragged into it. You were just out to have a good vacation. Dudley looks at Maggie sincerely. 
[14]You bikers probably tell all the girls that. This hits Dudley. He suddenly looks troubled. 
[15]You're not a geek, Dudley. You're sweet and your honest and... You're the coolest guy I know. Your cat is crazy if it doesn't like you as much as I do. Dudley smiles. He has completely fallen for her. 
[16]Well, I better get back inside. I've got to set some chairs up in the family room for the lunch rush. People gotta eat. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 96. Maggie smiles and heads inside. Dudley watches her go, then grits his teeth. 
[17]Hey, guys. Where's Dudley? 
[18]No. I thought he went to find you guys. Doug shares a worried glance with Bob and Woody. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 100. 
[19]Sweet Dudley. He went there to save everybody and now they're going to break his hands. 
[20]Wait, he did this because of me. I have a thousand dollars in tip money I want to put in.
dialogues.BUD:
[1]Oh, don't tell me they're here again already. I just got the window replaced. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 56. Bud walks back to the bar, past his daughter (and diner waitress) MAGGIE, 28, pretty in that cute, small town way. 
[2]Good morning, gentleman. How nice of you to join us this afternoon. 
[3]But you'll change that, huh? 
[4]God Dammit! What'd we do to deserve this!? We ANGLE TO SEE: MAGGIE rush over to calm BUD down. Bud calms down, then hears another motorcycle engine roaring down the street. He looks out the window and shakes his head. 
[5]Not another one of these assholes. A moment later, MURDOCK, a fat, grungy Hells Angel, enters the diner with a cocky swagger and has a seat at the bar. 
[6]Wait... You guys aren't Hells Angels? 
[7]Charley!? They ain't the bad ones! CHARLEY, the sheriff from before, stands up from behind a countertop in the kitchen. 
[8]Thought you might be out here. Doug turns and sees BUD, the owner of the diner, Bud has a seat next to him. 
[9]Well, maybe it's trying to and you just won't let it. 
[10]It's the funny thing about life. It has to be an adventure to feel right. But when you become a husband and a Dad, you realize adventure is risk, and a family man has no place in his life for risk. Doug takes this in, then realizes. 
[11]Yup. And if you try to make livin' too safe, then it's not livin' at all. 
[12]Well, maybe these will help you find it. Bud puts a styrofoam container on Doug's lap. Doug looks into it. 
[13]Yup. To fish with. 
[14]Friends that screw up. Angry bikers. That's not something you should be avoiding. That's something you need. Doug takes this in. 
[15]Go down to the lake and find out. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 91. Bud smiles and walks off. Doug looks down at the worms, considering... 
[16]If you're heading back to town, I wouldn't go on an empty stomach. The guys see Bud and smile. 
[17]Come have lunch. This is kind of our "fallout" diner. Smaller kitchen, but less piss on the bathroom floor. 
[18]I have a couple thousand in the diner emergency fund I'll put in, too. Doug, who has been thinking all this over, stands up from his chair. 
[19]That's right. You mess up our town, we'll do the same to you! The crowd cheers as THOMAS MILBORN, the guy Earl pointed out as a child molester, steps forward.
dialogues.KAREN:
[1]Are you kidding me!? You work in our guest bedroom, not an office. 
[2]Yeah, and I have to go to a job that actually makes us money, Bob. So, get out here and tell Haley she's not going anywhere! Bob nods obediently and hurries out of the room. 
[3]Did you talk to her? Tell me you talked to her. God! I have to do everything! Just get Claire to ballet. She's late. 
[4]Your little article for the "Web" magazine, Bob? "wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 6. 
[5]I have a shareholder meeting. And we agreed that my career would be the priority, and you would work out of the house. You might not like it, but my job is higher paying. And I don't see you complaining about that hundred dollar shirt you're wearing. Bob looks down at his too-hip dress shirt. 
[6]Oh, you don't like the shirt now? Fine. Take it off. 
[7]Take it off! You don't want to wear nice things, don't. Off! Bob sighs and takes the shirt off. Karen snatches it from him. 
[8]Now take Claire to her ballet class. It's starts in five minutes. 
[9]Go! Five minutes! Karen pushes Bob out the door, with Claire skipping happily behind him. 
[10]Bob!? You said two minutes! I'm not circling!! Bob cringes. Doug shares a look with Kelly, then to Bob: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 29. 
[11]I told you I was coming, Bob! 
[12]Well, I hope you guys had a nice trip. Now get in the van. We're going home. 
[13]Oh, no. No way! I came all the way out here, rented a car, drove to this podunk 
[14]Okay. Sorry... Just... be careful. Karen shyly kisses Bob on the cheek. Bob can't believe it.
dialogues.EARL:
[1]I'm Earl and he's Buck. Just remember, the brother with the word "ear," in his name, has both on his head. I can only say that because I'm on his right side. Which as you can see, is blown off. Earl laughs again, as BUCK extends his hand - oblivious. 
[2]We do have convicted child molesters, though. We have to disclose that. 
[3]Just to be safe, though.  Hey!! Thomas Milborn! A bookish man with a tweed jacket turns around and looks. 
[4]Convicted child molester. Thomas Milborn nods glumly and pulls his hands out of his pockets. The guys look at each other uneasily. 
[5]Yup. Big cans, too. Buck liked her, but you know... He's a deformed freak. Buck, on Earl's left, stares out at Maggie and Dudley, deaf to the conversation. 
[6]Yup. Even torn-open head, here. He nods at Buck, on his left. 
[7]Yup. Right on the ass. Then high-tail it out of there, because he can kill ya. 
[8]You know, people have feelings. Sure, I make comments about "chum face," here. But that's because every time I look at him I see parts of his brain. But nobody has the right to hurt Charley like that. He has both sides of his head. Earl storms off, leaving BUCK, who was standing on his left and hasn't heard or seen any of them leave. He stands there, looking at Doug and Dudley. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 87. 
[9]Just keep your eyes forward and head up. 
[10]Goddammit. Earl helps Buck up and they join the guys at their table. 
[11]Sorry. Buck looks around the table. 
[12]You guys were a blessing to this place. I mean... I'm not going to get all emotional like "hamburger head" here always does. Earl laughs and looks to his left. Buck isn't there. He quickly looks to the right, where Buck is staring at him in disbelief. 
[13]Um...
dialogues.BUCK:
[1]I'm Buck and this is Earl. Good luck telling us apart! Buck laughs and turns to Charley, exposing his missing ear to the guys. They draw back a little. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 71. 
[2]I used to like that girl... but then I realized, I can do better. The guys look at Buck. 
[3]You know, I slapped the bull once. Woody smiles slyly. Doug looks concerned. 
[4]Yeah, and we've never seen it done twice in a row. It'll be interesting to see how the bull takes being slapped now that he's alert. 
[5]Huh? Buck turns and sees Earl and Charley have gone. 
[6]Son of a bitch. Buck hurries out the door after Charley and Earl. 
[7]I'm fine. Buck walks a few more steps, then starts to tilt left. He quickly loses his balance and falls sideways, taking out a card table full of food and the old man sitting at it. 
[8]Hey, guys. Having your final meal? Buck and Earl laugh. Nobody else does. 
[9]Hey, isn't one of you missing? 
[10]What'd you just call me? 
[11]It's just a little scar! I'm still better looking than you! Buck goes to storm off, but after a few steps, tilts left and falls over. 
[12]Dammit! Doug shakes his head, then turns to Woody and Bob.
dialogues.OILCAN:
[1]Ow! Shit, man! Jack listens as the engines pass the bar and fade away. Jack shakes his head, enraged. 
[2]Try and watch the throws, okay Jack? Jack glares at oilcan for a beat, then jabs a dart into his peck. 
[3]Owww! Jesus!  Sorry. 
[4]I got my old lady bringing some gas. We can get moving by nightfall. 
[5]You're going to put balls in your mouth? The gang laughs. Jack realizes what the joke is... 
[6]Sometimes it helps if you say things in your mind first, then say it out loud, you know? Jack looks at Oilcan for a beat, then bends down, picks a dart up out of the ash, and jabs it into his shoulder. 
[7]Oww! Dammit! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 67. 
[8]Hell yeah we are!! Wheeew! Oilcan smashes a beer can against his own head. 
[9]What? 
[10]No we don't. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 98. 
[11]Ahhhhhh! He shot me! I just got shot!! Charley looks over at Buck, then back to Jack.
dialogues.COMPUTER VOICE:
[1]Dudley? ANGLE ON: DUDLEY FRANK , an odd-looking, curly- haired guy with black plastic glasses that are slightly too big for his face. He stares at a computer in front of him. 
[2]It is now nine o'clock am. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 9. 
[3]Command unknown. 
[4]It is now nine o'clock am. 
[5]Internet open. Dudley laughs good-naturedly. 
[6]Searching "alternative sex." 
[7]Two million websites found. 
[8]Searching "sex all the day with child."
dialogues.BILLY:
[1]I'll eat 'em. Doug gives Billy a look. 
[2]That doesn't work. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 2. 
[3]Dentists go to medical school? Doug looks a little insulted. 
[4]The battery ith gone in that thing. You took them out for the TV clicker. Doug gives Billy a look. 
[5]Uh uh. Carbth. Doug nods, defeated, as Billy hops up and dumps the remaining lucky charms in the trash. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 3. 
[6]Really? 
[7]Awesome! Hey, can I jam the radio?
dialogues.ROGER:
[1]Excuse me, everybody. I have a little toast. For my daughter and her husband. Roger winks at Doug and Kelly. Doug smiles weakly. 
[2]I want to start by saying how proud I am of my son-in-law. 
[3]Now, I have to make an admission. Ten years ago, when Doug and Kelly got married. I was worried. Doug was a little wild... The guests laugh. Doug gives an unsure chuckle. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 23. 
[4]I mean, he had that old trans-am with the huge engine... Remember how he'd peel out of anywhere? Even the grocery parking lot after buying baby formula? The guests laugh again. Now Doug isn't. 
[5]Or the way he'd just grab Kelly and run off to some crazy island to snorkel with something that thinks you're lunch. The guests continue to laugh. Kelly looks at Doug, now. She sees this is landing on him. He's getting upset. 
[6]But, not anymore. He's now become the son-in-law I would have always hoped for. Responsible, reliable, and a great husband to my daughter. So cheers to-- 
[7]Come on, Doug. You should be proud! You've grown up! Cheers! The guests nod and clink their glasses. Doug shakes his head.
dialogues.HIGHWAY PATROLMAN:
[1]You guys all right? 
[2]All right. Just making sure. Looks pretty comfortable, actually. We see the highway patrolman has started rubbing his thigh. Doug quickly jumps up, waking the others. 
[3]All right, I get it. Five's a crowd. Doug is mortified. The officer looks them over for a moment. 
[4]You guys are lucky to have each other.  Damn lucky. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 39. 
[5]Well... Have a good one. The patrolman walks off. Dudley looks at Doug and grins. 
[6]Saw you're bikes out there. You guys ever chicken fight? The guys look at each other for a moment, then;
dialogues.MURDOCK:
[1]Get me a beer, old man. And if it's not good, I'm going to smash it across your face. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 60. ANGLE ON: The WILD HOGS, watching from the table behind Murdock. 
[2]What'd you say? 
[3]That's my gang. I'm on my way there now. 
[4]Excuse me? Murdock puts his beer down, and stares angrily at Doug. 
[5]And who the hell are you freaks? Doug starts to answer, but Woody, looking nervous, cuts him off. 
[6]Hells Angel's don't give permission. Especially to a bunch of ball-less wimps like you. Bob hammers the table and stands up - his face red with long-suppressed rage.
